alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 2:47AM PDT until March 30 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches possible above 5000 feet with locally 10 to 14 inches on higher peaks. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 PM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level will fall to around 4000 feet tonight, then rise to 4000 to 4500 feet on Thursday. The most significant snowfall is expected above 5000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
